title: Beaver transfers reveal landing spots
body_text:
Beaver transfers reveal landing spots
CORVALLIS Ore. (KPTV) - Three former Oregon State University athletes have found new homes after hitting the NCAA transfer portal.
Womenâ€™s basketball players Raegan Beers and Talia von Oelhoffen have transferred to the University of Oklahoma and USC, respectively, the pair announced Monday.
Beers was the teamâ€™s leading scorer and rebounder from their Elite Eight run this past season, averaging 17.5 points and 10.3 rebounds per game. The sophomore forward made the announcement on her Instagram page.
Von Oelhoffen told ESPN of her commitment to the Trojans, who also made the Elite Eight of this yearâ€™s NCAA Tournament. The guard will have one season of eligibility remaining, having averaged double-figure scoring in each of her four seasons with the Beavers, including three as a starter.
The Kennewick, Washington native led the team with five assists per game this season.
Running back Damien Martinez announced his commitment to the University of Miami on social media over the weekend.
